◆ AM_HAL_BURST_LDO_VDDF_ADJ_CODE_30MV

#define AM_HAL_BURST_LDO_VDDF_ADJ_CODE_30MV   3

◆ AM_HAL_BURST_LDO_WORKAROUND

#define AM_HAL_BURST_LDO_WORKAROUND   1

Option to Enable LDO Burst mode workaound.

When entering burst mode, the 96MHz clock is active prior to Burst Active is enabled. This is not an issue on all chips.

AM_HAL_BURST_LDO_WORKAROUND: 0 = Use existing sequence when entering burst mode 1 = Burst LDO into Active mode and delay before enabling 96MHz CLK Default: 1

◆ am_hal_burst_mode_status

#define am_hal_burst_mode_status ( )     (CLKGEN->FREQCTRL_b.BURSTSTATUS ? AM_HAL_BURST_MODE : AM_HAL_NORMAL_MODE)

Return current burst mode state.

Implemented as a macro, this function returns the current burst mode state. AM_HAL_BURST_MODE AM_HAL_NORMAL_MODE

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_burst_ldo_charge()

void am_hal_burst_ldo_charge ( void  )

Burst LDO to charge VDDS cap.

This function changes burst LDO power init to charge VDDS cap and put Burst LDO into LP mode after chip power up

◆ am_hal_burst_ldo_patch_check()

bool am_hal_burst_ldo_patch_check ( void  )

Check if Burst LDO Patch is applied.

◆ am_hal_burst_mode_disable()

uint32_t am_hal_burst_mode_disable ( am_hal_burst_mode_e *  peBurstStatus)

Burst mode disable function.

Parameters
peBurstStatus- resulting mode after call.

This function disables the Apollo3 MCU from Burst Mode operation. It returns the MCU to Normal Mode.

Returns
status of API call.

Burst mode enable function.

◆ am_hal_burst_mode_initialize()

uint32_t am_hal_burst_mode_initialize ( am_hal_burst_avail_e *  peBurstAvail)

Burst mode initialization function.

Parameters
peBurstAvail- Availibility of feature

This function initializes the Apollo3 MCU for Burst Mode operation. It does not set the MCU into Burst Mode. This should be called once at system initialization if Burst Mode is going to be used in the system.

Returns
status of API call.
